Sequence Information.Function: The very low antimicrobial potency (MIC>200 ÂµM) against Escherichia coli and Staphylococcus aureus associated with the peptides is probably a consequence of their lack of amphipathicity and reduced cationicity compared with active members of the ocellatin family from related species.

Literature.Title: Purification and characterization of antimicrobial peptides from the Caribbean frog, Leptodactylus validus (Anura Leptodactylidae).
Literature.Author: King JD, Leprince J, Vaudry H, Coquet L, Jouenne T, Conlon JM.
